Class RadioIconFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.bananapuncher714.radioboard.providers.canvas.RadioIconFactory

  • public final class RadioIconFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Construct various RadioIcons from given parameters
    Author:
    BananaPuncher714

    • Method Detail

      • constructSwitch

        public static RadioIconSwitch constructSwitch(java.awt.Image on,
                                              java.awt.Image off,
                                              int width,
                                              int height,
                                              java.lang.String commandOn,
                                              java.lang.String commandOff)
        Gets a new RadioIconSwitch
        Parameters:
        on - The image when the switch is on
        off - The image when the switch is off
        width - The width in pixels of the switch
        height - The height in pixels of the switch
        commandOn - A command that is ran when the switch is turned on
        commandOff - A command that is ran when the switch is turned off
        Returns:
        A RadioIconSwitch made from all the parameters

        height - The new height

        Construct a normal button
        Parameters:
        clicked - The clicked image
        unclicked - The unclicked image
        width - Width of the button
        height - Height of the button
        command - Command that will be executed when pressed
        buttonDelay - How long the button stays depressed

      • constructCloud

        public static RadioIconCloud constructCloud(int width,
                                            int height,
                                            int transparency,
                                            int delay)
        Constructs a dynamic cloudy filter
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the cloud effect
        height - Height of the cloud effect
        transparency - Transparency of the cloud
        delay - How fast it updates in milliseconds, do not make this too fast or the client will timeout
        Returns:
